channel.title: shelly plugin on Shelly CLI
channel.description: Recent content in shelly plugin on Shelly CLI

item.title: shelly plugin create
item.description:
shelly plugin create

Create a new extension scaffold

Synopsis

Create a new extension scaffold with boilerplate code.

Supported languages:

  • bash (default): Shell script extension
  • go: Go language extension
  • python: Python extension

The extension will be created in the current directory or the directory specified with –output.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly plugin - Manage CLI plugins

item.title: shelly plugin exec
item.description:
shelly plugin exec

Execute an extension

Synopsis

Execute an extension explicitly with the given arguments.

This is useful when the extension name conflicts with a built-in command or when you want to explicitly invoke an extension.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly plugin - Manage CLI plugins

item.title: shelly plugin install
item.description:
shelly plugin install

Install an extension

Synopsis

Install an extension from a local file, URL, or GitHub repository.

Supported sources:

  • Local file: ./path/to/shelly-myext
  • GitHub repo: gh:user/shelly-myext
  • HTTP URL: https://example.com/shelly-myext

The extension must be named with the shelly- prefix.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly plugin - Manage CLI plugins

item.title: shelly plugin list
item.description:
shelly plugin list

List installed extensions

Synopsis

List installed extensions.

Extensions are external plugins that add new commands to the CLI. They are standalone executables named ‘shelly-*’ that can be installed from git repositories or created locally.

By default, only shows extensions installed in the user plugins directory. Use –all to show all discovered extensions including those in PATH.

Output is formatted as a table by default. Use -o json or -o yaml for structured output suitable for scripting.

item.title: shelly plugin remove
item.description:
shelly plugin remove

Remove an installed extension

Synopsis

Remove an installed extension.

Only extensions installed in the user plugins directory can be removed. Extensions found in PATH cannot be removed with this command.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly plugin - Manage CLI plugins

item.title: shelly plugin upgrade
item.description:
shelly plugin upgrade

Upgrade extension(s)

Synopsis

Upgrade installed extension(s) to the latest version.

If a name is provided, upgrades only that extension. Use –all to upgrade all installed extensions.

Note: This command checks GitHub for newer releases. Extensions must have been originally installed from GitHub (the repo info is stored in plugin metadata). For extensions installed from local files or URLs, you need to reinstall manually.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly plugin - Manage CLI plugins
